channel.title: N1ghtw1re Studios Blog
channel.description: Thoughts, manifestos, and digital philosophy from the collective.

item.title: Pixels & Passion - Why Retro Design Resonates in a Bland Digital Age
item.description: We use retro elements not just for their aesthetic appeal, but for their ability to communicate a sense of authenticity, of individuality, and of rebellion.

item.title: The IndieWeb Movement - Building a People-First Internet
item.description: The core philosophy of the IndieWeb is simple: you own your content. You publish it on your own website, your own domain, and you syndicate it elsewhere, if you choose.

item.title: Our Manifesto: Building the Internet We Were Promised
item.description: The internet was supposed to be a place of freedom, innovation, and community. Instead, it's become a walled garden of surveillance, manipulation, and monopoly power. It's time to take it back.

item.title: Algorithms Aren't Your Friends
item.description: How recommendation engines are designed to addict rather than enrich, and what we can do about it.

item.title: The Beige Web
item.description: How design homogenization is making the internet a boring place, and why we should embrace the weird again.

item.title: GeoCities and Angelfire: A Digital Archaelogy
item.description: Exploring the ruins of the early web and what we can learn from its creative chaos.

item.title: Digital Footprints: What You Leave Behind
item.description: Understanding and controlling the trace of data we generate with every click, swipe and scroll.

item.title: Beyond the Cookie Banner
item.description: How current privacy protections are mere theater, and what real privacy online could look like.

item.title: Why "Free" Online Services Are Anything But
item.description: The hidden costs of surveillance capitalism and the data economy.

item.title: The Power of Open Source
item.description: How collaborative development leads to more secure, innovative, and ethical software.
